welcome.title: Welcome to the Movement to Onomatopoeia Study
welcome.introduction: Thank you for agreeing to participate in this survey. As a dancer or a movement practitioner we consider you an expert and it is in this capacity that we would like you to help our research on movement onomatopoeia in Japanese. Onomatopoeia are sounds such as XXXX or YYYY that, while not being officially a word in Japanese, can convey meaning (animal sound, feeling, sensation, movement, shape, textureâ€¦) through the quality of the sound itself.
welcome.description: We will be presenting you short animations (based on movement capture of actual persons). Each animation depicts an expressive whole body movement.

instructions.title: What you'll do:
steps: Upon a second viewing, come up with an onomatopoeia that you feel, intuitively, that fits the animated motion sequence or a part of it.
Write down the onomatopoeia and mark the time when it occurs (it could correspond to the entire sequence as well).
You can describe multiple moments in each video if you want

additional_info.no_onomatopoeia: It is also possible that some of the animated sequences do not evoke any onomatopeia for you. This is fine too. You can watch and re-watch the video as many times as necessary before passing to the next one.
additional_info.about_onomatopoeia: Regarding the onomatopeia: some onomatopeia in Japanese have a very specific and established meaning (for example: XXXX means for many people YYYY). This will most probably not be the case in these videos. What we ask you to do is to freely associate these sequences with onomatopeia (it doesn't matter if the chosen onomatopoeia has already an established meaning in a different context).
additional_info.intuition_emphasis: Please follow your own intuition! There is no right or wrong answer!

form.movement_practice_placeholder: e.g., dance, somatics, manual therapy, movement analysis...
